Chris, the binary encoding is an intuitive idea but generally I would rec=
ommend against trying to encode binary numbers in banks of multiple inputs =
because the network would end up needing to evolve some kind of binary deco=
der to convert them back to a single continuum.  In other words, you would =
likely  add the problem of evolving a binary decoder on top of the original=
 problem, which would only compound its difficulty.  In general, a good ide=
al to strive for is to keep the coordinate system of the inputs as simple a=
s possible with respect to the computations it will need to do.  That is no=
t always clear, but as a rule of thumb it can help to guide input design de=
cisions.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "garrerc" <garrerc@...> wrote:
=
>
> I'm totally new to all of this, but I think you might consider two "ban=
ks" of inputs that each encode a binary number.  The first bank is the bina=
ry encoding (01001 for node #9 for instance) for one node and the second ba=
nk is the same for the second node.
> 
> I think it all depends on what kin=
ds of patterns you think might exist with respect to the node IDs I guess. =
 I mean, if you think that all nodes whose IDs are divisible by 3 evenly ar=
e connected to those whose IDs are divisible by 3 with a modulus of 1, then=
 doing a different encoding scheme taking that into effect might work bette=
r.
> 
> Again, I'm a NN novice and just starting to learn NEAT myself!
> 
>=
 
> -- Chris
> 
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "p_mridul" <p_mridul@> wr=
ote:
> >
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I am working on a bioinformatics problem, but it'=
s easier to talk about it in graph theory terms....
> > 
> > I have a graph=
 with a large number of nodes (~9000), and about 3000 edges between the nod=
es... I am planning to feed this as training data, and then see if the resu=
lting NN will predict the probability of an edge given any 2 nodes.
> > 
> =
> I have questions of how to encode the inputs... do I create an input arra=
y of 9000 inputs and pass in the couple of 1's corresponding to the nodes, =
or do I choose 2 inputs & pass in the node numbers?
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > Mr=
idul.
> >
>
